name: Ghee Rice
history: Ghee Rice, a popular dish in Indian cuisine, is known for its rich aroma and flavor. It's a simple yet elegant dish made with ghee (clarified butter), basmati rice, and a few spices, often served at special occasions and festivals.
description: Ghee Rice is a flavorful and aromatic rice dish made by cooking basmati rice in ghee with spices like cloves, cardamom, and cinnamon. It's a delightful combination of nutty ghee flavor and fragrant spices, often served with curries or raita.

instructions.title: Prepare the Rice
instructions.description: Wash the basmati rice until the water runs clear. Soak it in water for 15-20 minutes, then drain.

instructions.title: Cook the Rice
instructions.description: In a pot, heat the ghee. Add the whole spices (cloves, cardamom, cinnamon, bay leaf) and sautÃ© for a minute. Add sliced onions and cook until they are golden brown. If using, add cashew nuts and raisins, and fry until the nuts are golden. Add the drained rice and fry for a few minutes. Pour in water, add salt, and bring it to a boil. Reduce the heat, cover, and simmer until the rice is cooked and water is absorbed.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Fluff the rice gently with a fork. Serve the Ghee Rice hot with your choice of curry or raita.

tips: Use good quality basmati rice for the best flavor and texture.
Do not overcook the rice; it should be fluffy and each grain should be separate.
variations: Add fried onions on top for added flavor and texture.
Experiment with different nuts like almonds or pistachios.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat in a microwave or on a stove until warm.
presentationTips: Garnish with fresh herbs or additional fried onions for a more appealing presentation.
Serve in a decorative bowl or platter to enhance visual appeal.
